frames.text: When the seventh day came, God had finished his work. So God rested from all he had been doing. He blessed the seventh day and made it holy, because on this day he rested from his work. This is how God created the universe and everything in it.Nang sumapit ang ikapitong araw, tapos na ng Diyos ang lahat ng gagawin niya, kaya nagpahinga siya. Pinagpala niya ang ikapitong araw. Ginawa niya itong banal, dahil nagpahinga siya sa araw na ito. Ganito nilikha ng Diyos ang lahat ng bagay.Sên niras say ikapituy allu, nayari yan Bapan Namalyari ya kaganawan dinyag na. Kabay nagpaynawa ya. Pinagpala nay ikapituy allu buy dinyag nan banal, gawan nagpaynawa ya sa allun ati. Parabaysên dinyag Bapan Namalyari ya kaganawan bagay.

Then God said, “Now that the human beings have become like us by knowing good and evil, they must not be allowed to eat the fruit of the tree of life and live forever.” So God sent Adam and Eve away from the beautiful garden. God placed large, powerful angels at the entrance to the garden to keep anyone from eating the fruit of the tree of life.Sinabi ng Diyos, “Naging katulad na natin ang mga tao. Alam na nila ang mabuti at ang masama. Hindi sila dapat makakain ng bunga ng puno ng buhay dahil hindi sila mamamatay.” Kaya pinaalis ng Diyos sina Adan at Eba sa magandang halamanan. Naglagay din siya ng malalaki at malalakas na mga anghel sa pagpasok ng halamanan para pigilan ang mga tao na makakain ng bunga ng puno ng buhay.Sinabin Bapan Namalyari, “Kaparisu tamina amêsên na mani tawu. Tanda lay nay mangêd buy nadawak. Dapat a silay na makaêkan tagêy puun kayuy mam-in biyay ta dat a silay na mati.” Kabay inpatas Bapan Namalyari si Adan buy si Eba sa mangêd da panamnan. Nam-i ya êt mangaragul buy nangapas-êy ya mani ang-el sa dadanan palaku sa panamnan  amên asê makasun na mani tawu baydu buy a sila makaêkan tagêy puun kayuy mam-in biyay.

God then made the first rainbow as a sign of his promise. Every time the rainbow appeared in the sky, God would remember what he promised and so would his people.Pagkatapos ay gumawa ang Diyos ng isang bahaghari bilang palatandaan ng pangako niya. Kaya tuwing may lilitaw na bahaghari, naaalala ng Diyos at ng mga tao ang kanyang pangako.Pamakayari, nanyag buwangaw si Bapan Namalyari bilang patanda sa pangaku na. Kabay balang magpakit ta buwangaw, maganakan Bapan Namalyari buy mani tawu ya pangaku na.

Then God made a covenant with Abram. A covenant is an agreement between two parties. God said, “I will give you a son from your own body. I give the land of Canaan to your descendants.” But Abram still had no son.Pagkatapos ay nakipagtipan ang Diyos kay Abram. Ang tipan ay isang kasunduan ng dalawang panig. Sinabi ng Diyos, “Bibigyan kita ng anak na lalaki. Ibibigay ko din sa iyo at sa iyong mga apo ang Canaan.” Pero hanggang sa sandaling iyon, wala pa ring anak si Abram.Pamakayari, nangaku si Bapan Namalyari kan Abram, “Biyan katan anak ka liyaki. Idin ku kamu buy sa maapu muy  lugal un Canaan.” Nuwa sa panawun na abitu, ayin pun êt anak si Abram.

chapters.title: 4. Ya Pangakun Bapan Namalyari kan Abram ====

frames.text: Then God said to Abraham, “Because you were willing to give me everything, even your only son, I promise to bless you. Your descendants will be more than the stars in the sky. Because you have obeyed me, all the families of the world will be blessed through your family.”Pagkatapos, sinabi ng Diyos kay Abraham, “Dahil handa mong ibigay sa akin ang lahat, pati ang iyong anak, ipinapangako ko sa iyo na pagpapalain kita. Magiging kasingdami ng bituin sa langit ang mga apo mo. At dahil sinunod mo ako, lahat ng pamilya sa buong daigdig ay pagpapalain ko sa pamamagitan ng pamilya mo.”Pamakayari, sinabi Bapan Namalyari kan Abraham, “Gawan nakal-an kan idin kangkuy kaganawan, pati yay anak muy liyaki, pan-ipangaku ku kamuy pagpalên kata. Buy si maapu mu, pakadyag kasin lakên bêtêwên sa langit. Buy gawan sinunul mu ku, ya kaganawan pamilya sa babun luta, pagpalên ku sa kapamilatan mu.”

When Rebekah's babies were born, the older son came out red and hairy, and they named him Esau. Then the younger son came out holding on to Esau's heel, and they named him Jacob.Dumating ang araw ng panganganak ni Rebecca. Mapula at mabalahibo ang balat ng panganay. Tinawag niyang Esau ang sanggol. Ang bunso naman ay nakahawak sa paa ni Esau. Jacob ang ipinangalan nila sa bunso.Inlumatêng ngay allun panganak Rebecca. Naudit buy masabut ta balat panganay. Pinalagyunan lan Esau wa kulaw. Ya bungsuy naman, nakatalan ya sa bitis Esau. Jacob ya impalagyu la sa bungsu.

But Esau had already forgiven Jacob, and they were happily reunited. Jacob then lived peacefully in Canaan. Then Isaac died, and Jacob and Esau buried him. The covenant promises God had promised to Abraham and then to Isaac now passed on to Jacob.Mabuti na lang at napatawad na ni Esau si Jacob, kaya masayang masaya sila nang magkita ulit. Naging payapa na ang buhay ni Jacob sa Canaan. Nang mamatay si Isaac, siya ang naglibing sa kanyang ama. At ang pangako ng Diyos kina Abraham at Isaac ay ibinigay naman ng Diyos kay Jacob.Nuwa manay nan pinatawad Esau si Jacob. Kabay sên napikakit silan manguman, sadyay tula la. Napatêtbêk kay biyay Jacob sa Canaan. Sên nati si Isaac, in-ilbêng yan Esau buy si Jacob. Buy ya pangakun Bapan Namalyari kallan Abraham buy kan Isaac, impangakuy naman êt Bapan Namalyari kan Jacob.

The covenant promises that God gave to Abraham were passed on to Isaac, then to Jacob, and then to Jacob’s twelve sons and their families. The descendants of the twelve sons became the twelve tribes of Israel.Ang pangako ng Diyos kay Abraham ay ipinagpatuloy niya kay Isaac, at pagkatapos ay kay Jacob at pagkatapos ay sa labindalawang anak ni Jacob at sa kani-kanilang pamilya. Ang lahi ng mga anak niya ang naging labindalawang tribo ng Israel.Ya pangakun Bapan Namalyari kan Abraham, inpangaku na êt kan Isaac, kan Jacob, buy sa labinluway anak Jacob buy sa pamilya la. Ya layin mani anak na, sabay ya napakadyag labinluway tribun Israel.

chapters.title: 8. Inligtas Bapan Namalyari si Jose buy Pamilya na

frames.text: Moses did not want to go to Pharaoh because he thought he could not speak well, so God sent Moses’ brother, Aaron, to help him. God warned Moses and Aaron that Pharaoh would be stubborn.Pero ayaw ni Moises na pumunta sa hari ng Ehipto. Iniisip kasi niya na hindi siya magaling magsalita. Kaya inutusan din ng Diyos si Aaron, ang kapatid ni Moises, para tulungan siya. Sinabi din ng Diyos sa kanilang dalawa, “Magiging matigas ang ulo ng hari ng Ehipto.”Nuwa asê kalabay maku si Moises sa Arin Egiptu, gawan pan-isipin nay asê masalaysay ya pagsabi na. Kabay in-utus êt Bapan Namalyari ya patêl nay si Aaron amên sawpan ya. Sinabi êt Bapan Namalyari kallan luwa, “Pakadyag nakdêy ya ulun Arin Egiptu.”

Even after these nine plagues, Pharaoh still refused to let the Israelites go free. Since Pharaoh would not listen, there was one last plague that God planned to send. This would change Pharaoh’s mind.Nagmamatigas pa rin ang hari ng Ehipto kahit siyam na salot na ang naranasan nila. Hindi pa rin niya pinalaya ang mga Isarelita. Dahil ayaw talagang makinig ng hari, nagpadala ang Diyos ng isa pang salot at ito ang bumago sa isip ng hari.Nakdêy pun êt ta ulun Arin Egiptu agyan siyam may salut ta nadanasan la. A na pun êt inbus sa mani Israelita.  Tagawan asê kalabay mallêngêy Ari, mamipagtan si Bapan Namalyarin ikamapuy salut buy ati ya mamibayun isip Ari.

Nang gabi ding iyon, ipinatawag ng hari sina Moises at Aaron. Sinabi niya, “Isama mo na ang mga Israelita at umalis na kayo sa Ehipto.” Ganoon din ang sinabi sa kanila ng mga taga-Ehipto.Sa yabi êt ta abitu, inpabêg Ari silan Moises buy si Aaron. Sinabi na kalla, “Pakilaku minay mani Israelita buy mita kaw na sa Egiptu.” Para êt bayduy sinabi kallan mani taga Egiptu.

Iniutos sa kanila ng Diyos, “Ipagdiwang ninyo ang inyong tagumpay sa mga taga-Ehipto taun-taon. Gagawin ninyo ang Paskwa minsan isang taon. Kukuha kayo ng isang tupa na walang kapintasan, kakatayin ninyo ito at kakainin kasama ang tinapay na walang pampaalsa. Ganito ninyo ipagdiriwang ang pagliligtas sa inyo ng Diyos.”In-utus Bapan Namalyari kallay, “Balang  tawun, ipagkalutu yuy panambut yu sa mani taga Egiptu. Mangwa kaw gisay tupay mangêd, katatên  yuy ati buy kanên kaawyun na tinapay ya ayin pamalbag. Daygên yuy abiin bilang  pangganaka yu sa pamiligtas ku kamuyu.”

Umakyat ulit si Moises sa bundok. Nanalangin siya na patawarin ng Diyos ang mga tao. Pinatawad naman ng Diyos ang mga tao. Isinulat ulit ni Moises sa panibagong piraso ng bato ang mga utos ng Diyos. Pagkatapos, pinangunahan ulit ng Diyos ang mga Israelita sa paglalakbay nila papunta sa lupaing ipinangako ng Diyos sa kanila.Nanguman nagdakêy si Moises sa bung-uy. Nanalangin yan patawarên Bapan Namalyari ya mani tawu. Pinatawad daman Bapan Namalyari ya mani tawu.  In-uman insulat Moises sa bayun batuy  mani utus Bapan Namalyari. Pamakayari,  inawyunan manguman Bapan Namalyari ya mani Israelita sa pamita la papakun sa lugal la impangakun Bapan Namalyari kalla.

chapters.title: 13. Ya kasunduwan Bapan Namalyari buy mani Israelita

frames.text: God brought Moses to the top of a mountain so he could see the Promised Land. Moses saw the Promised Land but never entered it. Then Moses died, and the Israelites mourned for thirty days. Joshua became their new leader. Joshua was a good leader because he trusted and obeyed God.Pinaakyat ng Diyos si Moises sa isang mataas na bundok para makita niya ang lupaing ibibigay sa kanila ng Diyos. Natanaw ni Moises ang lupain pero hindi siya nakarating doon. Namatay si Moises sa bundok at nagluksa ang mga tao sa loob ng 30 araw. Pagkalipas ng pagluluksa, si Josue na ang nanguna sa kanila. Naging mabuting pinuno si Josue dahil nagtitiwala at sumusunod siya sa Diyos.Impadakêy Bapan Namalyari si Moises sa gisay matag-ay ya bung-uy amên makitan nay lugal la indin Bapan Namalyari kalla. Nabatsawan Moises ya lugal  nuwa aya nilaku baydu. Nati si Moises sa bung-uy buy naglungkut ya mani tawu sa tatlumpuy allu. Pamakayarin paglungkut la, si Josue yay mangawyun kalla. Nagin mangêd da pinunu si Josue gawan manampalataya ya buy manunul kan Bapan Namalyari.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Exodus 16-17; Numbers 10-14; 20; 27; Deuteronomy 34
chapters.title: 14. Kinabitan lan nagtêpan sa kakyangan

frames.text: When Joshua was an old man, he called all the people of Israel together. Then Joshua renewed the covenant that God had made with the Israelites at Sinai. The people promised to remain faithful to God and follow his laws.Nang matanda na si Josue, tinipon niya ang mga Israelita. Ipinaalala niya sa mga tao ang kanilang kasunduan sa Diyos. Nangako naman ang mga tao na hindi sila lalayo sa Diyos at susunod sila sa mga ipinapagawa sa kanila ng Diyos.Sên tuway na si Josue, tinipun nay mani Israelita. Impaganaka na sa mani tawuy kasunduwan la kan Bapan Namalyari. Nangakuy naman na mani tawu ya a sila magpakarayu kan Bapan Namalyari buy manunul sila sa mani pan-ipadyag Bapan Namalyari kalla.

chapters.title: 15. Ya Lugal la Impangakun Bapan Namalyari

frames.text: Finally, the people asked God for a king like all the other nations had. They wanted a king who was tall, strong, and could lead them into battle. God did not like this request, but He gave them what they wanted.Sa huli, humiling sila ng isang hari mula sa Diyos. Gusto nilang gayahin ang ginagawa ng ibang mga bansa. Ang gusto nilang hari ay yung matangkad, malakas, at mahusay sa labanan. Hindi gusto ng Diyos ang hinihingi ng mga Israelita, pero pinagbigyan pa rin niya.Sa kapupusan, inyawad la kan Bapan Namalyari ya biyan na silan ari kaparisun mani bansay nakapalitêng kalla. Ya labay lay ari ya idin Bapan Namalyari kalla, matag-ay, napas-êy buy makapanguna kalla sa laban. Si Bapan Namalyari, alwan parabayduy labay na, nuwa para man baydu, indin na murin na labay la kana.

But as punishment for his sin, David’s baby boy died. There was also fighting in David’s family for the rest of his life, and David’s power was greatly weakened. Though David had been unfaithful to God, God was still faithful to His promises. Bathsheba gave birth to another son named Solomon.Bilang parusa kay David, namatay ang anak nila ni Batseba. Nagkaroon din ng mga labanan sa pamilya niya. Humina na din pati ang paghahari niya. Pero kahit na nagkasala si David sa Diyos, tinupad pa din ng Diyos ang mga pangako niya kay David. Nagkaanak ulit sila ni Batseba. Pinangalanan nila ang sanggol na Solomon.Nuwa bilang parusa sa kasalanan na, si nalyari, nati ya anak nan David buy nabtês sa pamibêtêkbêtêk un pamilalamun pamilya na angga sa inlumatêng nga asêy na napas-êy ya pag-ari na. Si Arin David, agyan nakadyag yan kasalanan sa pangêlêw Bapan Namalyari, pawan napas-êy ya pangaku na kana. Amêsên, nakaanak si Batseban gisay na êt ta liyaki ya pinaglagyunan lan Solomon.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: 1 Samuel 10; 15-19; 24; 31; 2 Samuel 5; 7; 11-12
chapters.title: 17. Ya Kasunduwan un Bapan Namalyari buy si David

frames.text: The kings of Judah were descendants of David. Some of these kings were good men who ruled justly and worshiped God. But most of Judah’s kings were evil, corrupt, and idol-worshipers. Some of the kings even sacrificed their children to false gods. The people of Judah also rebelled against God and worshiped other gods.Mula naman sa lahi ni David ang mga naging hari sa Juda. May ilan sa kanila na naging mabuting hari at sumasamba sa Diyos. Pero marami sa mga naging hari ay masasama, malulupit at sumasamba sa mga rebulto. Ang ilan sa kanila ay naghahandog pa ng sariling anak sa mga rebulto. Madalas na hindi sumusunod ang mga taga-Juda sa Diyos, at ibang diyos ang sinasamba nila.Naubat taman sa layin David da nagin ari sa Juda. Dilag nagin mangêd da ari kalla buy mangulimên kan Bapan Namalyari. Nuwa malakê sa mani nagin ari ya nangadadawak. Matubag sila buy mangulimên sa mani ribultu. Ya dakun umnu kalla, mamiandug pun êt sarili lan anak sa mani ribultu. Pawan asê manunul la mani taga Juda kan Bapan Namalyari buy kaatag ga diyus ya pan-ulimênên la.

Even though the prophets were hated, they continued to speak for God. They warned people that they would be destroyed if they did not repent. They also reminded people of the promise that God’s Messiah would come.Patuloy na nagturo ang mga propeta kahit na nagagalit sa kanila ang mga tao. Sinasabi kasi nila sa mga tao, “Kapag hindi kayo nagsisi, parurusahan kayo ng Diyos.” Ipinapaalala din nila sa mga tao na darating ang isang Tagapagligtas ng lahat.Insundun mani prupetay panuru la agyan manubag kallay mani tawu. Sinabi la sa mani tawu, “Magsisi kaw na ta dat parusan kaw Bapan Namalyari.” Pan-ipatanda la êt sa mani tawuy lumatêng nga gisay Mamiligtas sa kaganawan.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: 1 Kings 16-18; 2 Kings 5; Jeremiah 38
chapters.title: 19. Ya Mani Prupeta

frames.text: When they arrived, they rebuilt the Temple and the wall around the city of Jerusalem. Although they were still ruled by other people, they lived in the Promised Land again and worshiped at the Temple.Pagdating nila sa Jerusalem, itinayo agad nila ang Templo at ang pader ng lungsod. Kahit na sila ay nasasakop ng ibang bansa, nakatira pa rin sila sa Canaan at nakakasamba pa din sa tunay na Diyos.Pamakalatêng la sa Jerusalem, impaydêng lan manguman na templu buy bakud balayan. Agyan pansakupên silan kaatag ga lugal, manugêl pun sila sa Canaan. Buy makaulimên sila pun êt sa pêtêg ga Bapan Namalyari.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: 2 Kings 17; 24-25; 2 Chronicles 36; Ezra 1-10; Nehemiah 1-13
chapters.title: 20. Nadakêp ya Israel buy nibus

frames.text: God showed the prophets many things about the coming Messiah, but the Messiah had not come yet. More than 400 years after the last of these prophecies was given, when the time was perfect, God sent the Messiah into the world.Ipinakita ng Diyos sa mg propeta ang maraming bagay tungkol sa darating na Tagapagligtas. Pero hindi pa dumarating noon ang Tagapagligtas. Mahigit 400 taon pa ang lumipas bago ipinadala ng Diyos ang Tagapagligtas ng lahat ng tao.Inpakit Bapan Namalyari sa mani prupetay malakêy bagay tungkul sa lumatêng nga Mamiligtas. Nuwa asê pun inlumatêng awlagi ya Mamiligtas. Apattaralan na tawun pun na inlumibas bayu inpagtan Bapan Namalyari ya Mamiligtas sa kaganawan tawu.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Genesis 3:15; 12:1-3; Deuteronomy 18:15; 2 Samuel 7; Jeremiah 31; Isaiah 59:16; Daniel 7; Malachi 4:5; Isaiah 7:14; Micah 5:2; Isaiah 9:1-7; 35:3-5; 61; 53; Psalm 22:18; 35:19; 69:4; 41:9; Zechariah 11:12-13; Isaiah 50:6; Psalm 16:10-11
chapters.title: 21. Ya Impangakun Bapan Namalyari ya Mamiligtas

frames.text: After Elizabeth gave birth to her baby boy, they named him John as the angel commanded. Then God allowed Zechariah to speak again. He said, “Praise God, because He has remembered His people! You, my son, will be called the prophet of the Most High God! You will prepare the way for the Messiah!”
When they saw Jesus with his mother, they fell down and worshiped him. They gave Jesus expensive gifts. Then they returned home.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 1; Luke 2
chapters.title: 23. The Birth of Jesus

frames.text: God had told John, “The Holy Spirit will land on someone you baptize. He is the Son of God.” There is only one God. But God is three persons, the Father, Jesus the Son, and the Holy Spirit.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 3; Mark 1:9-11; Luke 3:1-23
chapters.title: 24. John Baptizes Jesus

frames.text: Then Satan left him to wait for a better time. Angels came and took care of Jesus.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 4:1-11; Mark 1:12-13; Luke 4:1-13
chapters.title: 25. Satan Tempts Jesus

frames.text: Then Jesus chose twelve men who were called his disciples. The disciples were Jesus’ students. They traveled with him and learned from him.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from:Matthew 4:12-25; Mark 1:14-15, 35-39; 3:13-21; Luke 4:14-30, 38-44
chapters.title: 26. Jesus Starts His Ministry

frames.text: Then Jesus asked the lawyer, “Which one of the three men do you think was a neighbor to the man who was robbed and beaten?” The lawyer replied, “The one who showed mercy.” Jesus told the lawyer, “You go and do the same thing.”Amêsên, pinatang Jesus ya manurun kautusan, sinabi na, “Sa êlêw mu, sisabêt sa tatlun ati ya pêtêg ga nangidu sa kaparisu nan tawuy dinugêdugên mani tulisan?”Nakitbay ya manurun kautusan, “Sa êlêw kuy ya nalunus kana.”Kabay sinabin Jesus kana, “Dale ka. Para êt bayduy daygên mu.”

Jesus answered, “Everyone who has left houses, brothers, sisters, father, mother, children, or property for my name’s sake, will inherit 100 times more in the next world and also eternal life. But many who are first will be last, and those who are last will be first.”Nakitbay si Jesus, “Pakalêng-ên yuy ati. Nu sisabêt man na manlakwan bali' na, asawa na, mapatêl na, mangatwa na, buy maanak na gawan sa pag-arin Bapan Namalyari, mabiyan yan igit pun kaysa sa inlakwanan na sa panawun amên. Buy sa panawun na lumatêng, makatanggap ya êt biyay ya ayin katganan.”

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 19:16-30; Mark 10:17-31; Luke 18:18-30
chapters.title: 28. Ya liyaki ya mabandi

frames.text: Then Jesus said, “This is what my heavenly Father will do to every one of you if you do not forgive your brother from your heart.”

chapters.title: 29. The Story of the Unmerciful Servant

frames.text: The disciples even picked up twelve baskets full of leftover food that had not been eaten. All the food came from the five loaves of bread and two fish.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 14:13-21; Mark 6:31-44; Luke 9:10-17; John 6:5-15
chapters.title: 30. Jesus Feeds Five Thousand People

frames.text: When Peter and Jesus got into the boat, the wind immediately stopped. The disciples were amazed. They worshiped Jesus, saying to him, “Truly, you are the Son of God.”

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 14:22-33; Mark 6:45-52; John 6:16-21
chapters.title: 31. Jesus Walks on Water

frames.text: The woman fell on her knees before Jesus, shaking and very afraid. Then she told the whole truth. Jesus said to her, “Your faith has healed you. Go in peace and be healed of your sickness.”

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 8:28-34; Mark 5:1-20; Luke 8:26-39
chapters.title: 32. Jesus Heals a Demon-Possessed Man & A Sick Woman

frames.text: “But the seeds that fall on good soil represent people who hear the Word of God, believe it, and produce spiritual fruit.”

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 13:1-8, 18-23; Mark 4:1-8, 13-20; Luke 8:4-15
chapters.title: 33. The Story of the Farmer

frames.text: Then Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, the tax collector went home forgiven, and not the religious leader. Everyone who is proud will be humbled, but whoever humbles himself will be lifted up.”

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 13:31-33, 44-46; Mark 4:30-32; Luke 13:18-21; 18:9-14
chapters.title: 34. Jesus Teaches Other Stories

frames.text: “The father answered, ‘My son, you are always with me, and everything I have is yours. But it is right for us to celebrate, because your brother was dead, but now is alive. He was lost, but now is found!’”

chapters.title: 35. The Story of the Compassionate Father

frames.text: As they went back down the mountain, Jesus said, “Do not tell anyone about what happened here until after I have been raised from the dead.”

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 17:1-9; Mark 9:2-8; Luke 9:28-36
chapters.title: 36. The Transfiguration

frames.text: But the religious leaders of the Jews were jealous, so they gathered together to plan how they could kill Jesus and Lazarus.

chapters.title: 37. Jesus Raises Lazarus from the Dead

frames.text: As the soldiers arrested Jesus, Peter pulled out his sword and cut off the ear of the high priest’s servant. Jesus said, “Put the sword away! I could ask the Father for an army of angels to defend me. But I must obey my Father.” Then Jesus healed the man’s ear, and all the disciples ran away.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 26:14-56; Mark 14:10-50; Luke 22:1-53; John 18:1-11
chapters.title: 38. Jesus Is Betrayed

frames.text: But Pilate became afraid that a riot would start, so he handed Jesus over to them to be crucified. The soldiers whipped Jesus, put a royal robe and a crown made of thorns on him, and they mocked him, saying, “Look, the King of the Jews!”

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 26:57-27:26; Mark 14:53-15:15; Luke 22:54-23:25; John 18:12-19:16
chapters.title: 39. Jesus Is Put on Trial

frames.text: Then Joseph and Nicodemus, two Jewish leaders who believed Jesus was the Messiah, asked Pilate for Jesus’ body. They wrapped his body in cloth and buried it in a tomb cut out of rock. Then they rolled a large stone over the opening.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 27:27-61; Mark 15:16-47; Luke 23:26-56; John 19:17-42
chapters.title: 40. Jesus Is Crucified

frames.text: On the way, Jesus appeared to them, and they worshiped him. Jesus said, “Do not be afraid. Go and tell my disciples that I will see them in Galilee.”

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 27:62-28:15; Mark 16:1-11; Luke 24:1-12; John 20:1-18
chapters.title: 41. God Raises Jesus from the Dead

frames.text: “Remember, I will be with you always. Stay in Jerusalem until you receive power from above.” Then Jesus was taken up to heaven, and a cloud hid him from their sight. Jesus sat down at the right hand of God to rule over all things.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 28:16-20; Mark 16:12-20; Luke 24:13-53; John 20:19-23; Acts 1:1-11
chapters.title: 42. Jesus Returns to Heaven

frames.text: The believers devoted themselves to the disciples’ teaching, fellowship, eating together, and prayer. They all met together and shared everything they had. They praised God and were well received by those who were not Christians.

The leaders were shocked because they could see that these men were common men who were not well-educated. They also realized that these men had been with Jesus. After they had threatened Peter and John, they let them go.

chapters.title: 44. Peter and John Heal a Beggar

frames.text: The Ethiopian went on his way, happy to know Jesus.

After many days, the Jews made a plan to kill Paul. They placed people at the city gates to kill him. But Paul heard about the plan, and his friends helped him escape. One night they lowered him over the city wall in a basket. Paul ran away and continued preaching about Jesus.

Paul and other Christian leaders traveled to many cities, preaching and teaching about Jesus. They also wrote many letters to the churches to encourage and teach them about God’s New Covenant. These writings are called the New Testament.
Like David, Jesus is a king, but Jesus is the king of the universe! He will come again and rule his Kingdom with justice and peace.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Genesis 1-3, 6, 14, 22; Exodus 12, 20; 2 Samuel 7; Hebrew 3:1-6, 4:14-5:10, 7:1-8:13, 9:11-10:18; Revelation 21
chapters.title: 48. Jesus Is the Promised Messiah

frames.text: God tells you to pray, study His Word, worship Him with other Christians, and tell others what He has done for you. All of these things help you to grow in your relationship with Him.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Romans 3:21-26, 5:1-11; John 3:16; Mark 16:16; Colossians 1:13-14; 2 Thessalonians 5:17-21; 1 John 1:5-10
chapters.title: 49. God’s New Covenant

frames.text: And Jesus will reign forever and ever. He will wipe away every tear and there will be no more death, suffering, sadness, crying, evil, or pain. He will rule his Kingdom with peace and justice, and he will be with his people forever.

chapters.ref: A Bible story from: Matthew 24:14; 28:18; John 15:20, 16:33; Revelation 2:10; Matthew 13:24-30, 36-42; 1 Thessalonians 4:13-5:11; James 1:12; Matthew 22:13; Revelation 20:10, 21:1-22:21
chapters.title: 50. Jesus Returns
